featured.text: The design was intended to look as shiny and smooth as velvet.
Named “Velcro,” from the French words velours (velvet) and crochet (hook), the new product received a patent from the Swiss government in 1955.

definition.zh_def: 一種柔軟且有光澤的織物，通常由絲或棉製成，表面有短而密的絨毛。
definition.en_def: A soft and luxurious fabric, typically made from silk or cotton, characterized by a short, dense pile on its surface.
definition.example: She wore a beautiful dress made of red velvet to the party.
